title: all caps monospaced electro-mechanical printer type
content: Having A Problem Trying To Figure Out This Type Of Font Can Anyone Help Please.
author: glenivey63

comments.content:
I HAVE A PICTURE OF IT ON MY COMP AND AS OF NOW NO LUCK FINDING THE FONT STYLE

 ![](http://web.archive.org/system/files?file=LETTERS-2006.G.I..jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/system/files?file=UNKNOWN-FONT-2006.jpg)

(Looks like you have a problem with the Caps-Lock key too :^/)

It’s hard to say, given your small and limited sample.  
Can you show more characters?

First — no need for shouting, we hear you perfectly well. ;^)

Second — is that tiny sample with just two characters all you have? Are you looking for something [clean](http://web.archive.org/web/20060329200412/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=SG.9416.0.0&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=CY&sampleSize=48) or something [dirty](http://web.archive.org/web/20060329200412/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=FF.10869.2.6&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=CY&sampleSize=48)?

It looks like something printed on a ribbon by an electro-mechanical printer. This is not going to be a font, although maybe we could think of some fonts that simulate this kind of printer output.

- Mike Yanega
Could you please help in locating some fonts that look like this please.
all caps monospaced electro-mechanical printer type do you know were i could find fonts that look like these letters any help would be greatly appreciated thanks

I usually use [Letter Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20060329200412/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&font_categories=1&font_categories_search=font_name_search&searchstr=letter+gothic) if I’m trying to recreate this look, but I don’t know if there are better fonts out there.

- Lex
